alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 3:38PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central St. Tammany and southeastern Tangipahoa Parishes through 430 PM CDT... At 337 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Robert, or 7 miles west of Covington, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Tropical funnel clouds, winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Covington, Ponchatoula, Folsom and Robert. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 41 and 59. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 24 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern St. Tammany; Southwestern St. Tammany
